Application for Circle K: Circle K does not provide a printable job application. If you want to get a job at Circle K, you must apply for employment on the website by following the link above. Full-time or part-time positions may vary depending on the location.
Interview Tips: Go to the Circle K job interview questions&tips page.

Circle K is a chain of convenience stores known for their distinct logo of a red “k” inside a white circle. Primarily operated as convenience store locations, some sell gasoline in addition to a wide range of name- and off-brand products. Customers can find anything from food and drinks to magazines, sunglasses, lottery tickets, and more.
Circle K was founded in 1951 in El Paso, Texas. What started out as three simple locations in the Lone Star State has now grown to become the single largest convenience store chain in the United States, second only to 7-11 in number of overall locations. In addition to their U.S. stores, Circle K also has a global presence, with stores in countries like Mexico, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. Circle K is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Canadian-based Couche-Tard Corporation that operates over 6,000 convenience store locations and is the largest of its kind. Couche-Tard, which is French for “night owl,” also own and operate under the Dairy Mart, Daisy Mart, and Winks brand names.
With locations all over the United States and throughout the rest of the world, employment opportunities with Circle K are relatively easy to come by. Circle K consistently hires workers and associates for a number of different job titles. Work as an entry-level employee in customer service or in a career as a store manager. To apply for work with Circle K simply pick up an application for employment or continue reading to find out more about careers and opportunities for work with this industry leader.
Entry-level jobs available at Circle K exist as customer service representatives. Primary jobs duties for this position involve a great deal of customer service. Responsibilities may include greeting the customer, ringing up purchases, answering questions about products and services, and making sure the store is clean and orderly. Customer service workers should be friendly and motivated. No real experience is necessary for these position, however, the employer may favor those with a related work history.
Careers also exist within the company. Circle K is always looking for entry-level employees that want to take their career to the next level. Career opportunities are available as managers and include both supervisory and administrative duties. Specific responsibilities include setting schedules, hiring and training new employees, answer the phones, and communicating with the corporate office. This is a perfect way to build a resume and receive great pay while doing it. All applicants for these positions must be at least 18 years old. Some locations may require candidates have at least a high school diploma or equivalent. Fill out an application for more details.
In addition to great pay, all eligible employees have the ability to qualify for benefits packages that include a 401(k) retirement savings plan, medical and dental insurance plans, paid vacation and holidays, and more.
